subject: newbie question: how to avoid rerunning fixture code on every test
msgSnippet: I am pretty new to both junit and java programming.  I read most of the JUnit doc on the junit home page.   After reading the Cook s tour paper, it seems that
messageBody:
I am pretty new to both junit and java programming. I read most of the JUnit
doc on the junit home page. After reading the Cook's tour paper, it seems that
the design intent is to have the setup and teardown code allocate and release
all the test fixture objects for every seperate test, to avoid tests interfering
with eachother.

What if the setup logic involves connecting to databases and running queries
that tends to be a bit slow for doing on every single test? Is an explanation
available anywhere on the web telling how to get tests to run faster by
executing slow initialization code only once before all the tests?

thanks
